title: 114_hr5064
content: The Act titled "Improving Small Business Cyber Security Act of 2016" emphasizes the role of Small Business Development Centers in enhancing cyber security and preparedness. Section 21 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 648) is amended to provide access to business analysts who can refer small business concerns to available experts and offer assistance in line with the Small Business Development Center Cyber Strategy developed under the Improving Small Business Cyber Security Act of 2016. In subsection (c), paragraph (2) is modified to include additional provisions for small business cyber security measures. The Small Business Act is amended to provide access to cyber security specialists for small business concern clients in line with the Small Business Development Center Cyber Strategy developed under the Improving Small Business Cyber Security Act of 2016. SEC. 3 amends the Small Business Act to allow small business development centers to provide cyber security assistance to small businesses. This includes disseminating cyber security risk information and enhancing cyber security infrastructure, awareness, and training programs for employees. SEC. 4 focuses on cyber security outreach for small business development centers. Section 227 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to allow the Secretary to use small business development centers for cybersecurity outreach to assist small businesses in enhancing their cybersecurity infrastructure, awareness, and training programs. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to allow the Secretary to use small business development centers for cybersecurity outreach to assist small businesses in enhancing their cybersecurity infrastructure, awareness, and training programs. The term 'center' is defined under section 3 of the Small Business Act. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to allow the Secretary to use small business development centers for cybersecurity outreach to assist small businesses in enhancing their cybersecurity infrastructure, awareness, and training programs. Additionally, a GAO study will be conducted on small business cyber support services and small business development center cyber strategy. The Comptroller General of the United States will review current cyber security resources at the Federal level to assist small businesses with developing or enhancing cyber security infrastructure, threat awareness, and training programs for employees. This includes an assessment of Federal programs providing assistance to small businesses in these areas. The Comptroller General will review the utilization of cyber security resources by small businesses and assess if they are duplicative or accessible. A report will be issued to Congress, the Small Business Administration, and the Secretary of Homeland Security. Additionally, a Small Business Development Center Cyber Strategy must be developed within 90 days. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration and the Secretary of Homeland Security will collaborate to develop a Small Business Development Center Cyber Strategy within 90 days. This strategy will involve consulting with entities representing small business development centers and include plans for leveraging SBDCs to access existing cyber programs. The Small Business Administration and the Department of Homeland Security will collaborate to develop a Small Business Development Center Cyber Strategy to enhance cyber assistance for small businesses. This includes accessing existing cyber programs and providing counsel on improving cyber security infrastructure and training programs. The Small Business Administration and the Department of Homeland Security will collaborate to develop a cost-effective plan for implementing best practices in cyber security. This includes entering agreements with cyber information sharing entities and providing referrals to specialists when necessary. An analysis will be conducted on leveraging Federal Government programs for Small Business Development Centers. The Small Business Development Center Cyber Strategy will leverage partnerships with government and private entities to improve cyber support for small businesses. The strategy will be delivered to the Committees on Homeland Security and Small Business within 180 days of the report issuance. The term "small business development center" is defined in the Small Business Act. SEC. 6. PROHIBITION ON ADDITIONAL FUNDS. No extra funds can be allocated for this Act or its amendments. Existing authorized amounts will be used instead.
